Karl,

Offspring are assigned in proportion to the average fitness of the 
species.  Specifically, the offspring for a single species are 
assigned as follows:

Offspring = (AverageSpeciesFitness /Total_of_AverageSpeciesFitnesss) 
* PopulationSize 

Note the denominator is the sum of the average fitnesses of all the 
species.

For alternative ways to do fitness sharing, see the FAQ 
question, "Is there another way to do fitness sharing?"

ken

> I think I may have mis-implemented fitness sharing.
> 
> Is fitness sharing done by assigning the offspring
> proportional to average fitness of the species or
> cumulative fitness of the species.
> 
> ie-
> 
> f = fitness of an individual
> n = individuals in species
> 
> species fitness = sum(f)
> or 
> species fitness = sum(f)/n
